title: Bank Angle Indicators - Removal and Installation

body.body: Bank Angle Indicators - Removal and Installation
Bank Angle Indicators - Always Replace Worn Bank Angle Indicators Warning
Always replace the bank angle indicators before they are worn to their maximum limit.
Use of a motorcycle with bank angle indicators worn beyond the maximum limit will allow the motorcycle to be banked to an unsafe angle.
may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.

Inspect the bank angle indicators on the rider's footrests for wear. Bank angle indicators must be replaced when they have worn down to the maximum wear limit. The maximum wear limit is shown by a groove on the bank angle indicator.

The bank angle pegs must not be used as a guide to how far the motorcycle may be safely banked. This depends on many various conditions including, but not limited to, road surface, tyre condition and weather. Banking to an unsafe angle will lead to loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
